Fact.Description: Options for the filer to say whether a W2 is nonstandard, corrected, both, or neither

Fact.Description: Options for form type

Fact.Description: The codes New York requires for box 14

Fact.Name: W2 Minimum Amount
Fact.Description: The minimum amount of pay before an employer needs to issue a W2

Fact.Name: Maximum Medicare Wages for an MFS Filer
Fact.Description: The maximum medicare wages (W-2 Box 5) a MFS filer might have without possibly needing to pay Additional Medicare Tax

Fact.Name: Maximum Medicare Wages for an MRJ Filer
Fact.Description: The maximum medicare wages (W-2 Box 5) a MFS filer might have without possibly needing to pay Additional Medicare Tax

Fact.Name: Maximum Medicare Wages for non-MFS Filer
Fact.Description: The maximum medicare wages (W-2 Box 5) filers with a status other than MFS might have without possibly needing to pay Additional Medicare Tax

Fact.Name: Maximum Medicare Wages for non-MFS Filer
Fact.Description: The maximum medicare wages (W-2 Box 5) any individual on a return could have before needing to pay Additonal Medicare Tax

Fact.Name: Maximum Social Security Wages On Multiple W2s for one person
Fact.Description: The limit of Social Security Wages that one filer can have across multiple W2s before they might be entitely to a refund on social security payments. https://www.ssa.gov/oact/cola/cbb.html

Fact.Name: Form W-2s
Fact.Description: Form W-2: Wage and Tax Statement, used to report wage income and withholding.

Fact.Name: formW2s is Done
Fact.Description: The user has clicked "Done" for their formW2s

Fact.Name: At least one of Primary Filer's Form W2s are incomplete
Fact.Description: Whether at least one of Primary Filer's Form W2s are incomplete

Fact.Name: At least one of Secondary Filer's Form W2s are incomplete
Fact.Description: Whether at least one of Secondary Filer's Form W2s are incomplete

Fact.Name: Has W-2s
Fact.Description: Whether the TP has any W2s listed

Fact.Name: Has W-2s
Fact.Description: Whether the TP has any W2s listed. This fact will either be true or empty.

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to W2 Income
Fact.Description: At least one W2 has a set of facts that cause a knockout

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to Being Statutory Employee
Fact.Description: The TP requires statutory employee forms that we don't support

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to Third Party Sick Pay
Fact.Description: The TP requires third party sick pay forms that we don't support

Fact.Name: The filer(s) lives in a state that requests Box 14 data
Fact.Description: Whether we ask about the contents of box 14 because the integrated state tool needs it.

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to having RRTA codes in Box 14
Fact.Description: Knockout Due to having RRTA codes in Box 14

Fact.Name: Medicare Wages Additonal Tax Threshhold
Fact.Description: The filing-status based threshold at which a filer might need to pay aditional medicare taxes and thereby requires form 8959

Fact.Name: Knockout if Medicare Wages Great Than Max for filing status
Fact.Description: Knockout the filer if their total medicare wages are above the limit for their filing status that might necessitate form 8959

Fact.Name: Primary Filer Exceeds Max Social Security Wages
Fact.Description: Does the primary filer have Great Than 1 W-2 and social security wages over the limit that might entitle them to a socail security refund?

Fact.Name: Secondary Filer Exceeds Max Social Security Wages
Fact.Description: Does the primary filer have Greater Than 1 W-2 and social security wages over the limit that might entitle them to a socail security refund?

Fact.Name: Any Filer Exceeds Social Security Wages
Fact.Description: Does either filer have Greater Than 1 W-2 and social security wages over the limit that might entitle them to a social security refund?
At least one W2 has non-qualified plan values

Fact.Name: Has Seen last available screen
Fact.Description: Whether the user has seen the last available scren for this W2.

Fact.Name: Is Complete
Fact.Description: Whether the W2 is complete
Any W-2 has a validation error that should block submission until fixed
The w2 when there's only one
The taxpayer (and spouse) has only one W2. Used for logic in Care provider screens.

Fact.Name: Employee
Fact.Description: The taxpayer who received the W-2.

Fact.Name: Employee's overwritten TIN
Fact.Description: This is written to when the user has a non-SSN TIN which are not allowed on a W2. Previously we were always using this value instead of ../usedTin

Fact.Name: TIN associated with the form W2
Fact.Description: The actual TIN that is used and associated with the W2

Fact.Name: Flow variable for choosing TIN-related screens
Fact.Description: Whether the TIN of this W2's filer is an SSN.

Fact.Name: Employer identification number
Fact.Description: Box b of Form W-2, employer identification number (EIN).

Fact.Name: Employer's name
Fact.Description: The employer's name as appears in box c of Form W-2.

Fact.Name: MeF Employer Name
Fact.Description: Employer Name transformed for MeF. This may be removed next year, but right now exists to transform any data that existed from before we applied limits to ../employerName

Fact.Name: Employer's name line 2
Fact.Description: The employer's name as appears in line 2 box c of Form W-2. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete.Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations

Fact.Name: Employer's address
Fact.Description: The employer's address as appears in box c of Form W-2.

Fact.Name: Employer's address zip in MeF Format
Fact.Description: The employer's address zip, with hyphens and spaces stripped for MeF compliance

Fact.Name: Employee's suffix
Fact.Description:
The employee's suffix as appears in box e of Form W-2.
TODO: Enable placeholders to be written a normal derived facts

Fact.Name: Address on W-2 is same as tax return
Fact.Description: Whether Box f of Form W-2 contains the same address as the tax return.

Fact.Name: Employee's address, if it doesn't match the one on the return
Fact.Description: Box f of Form W-2, employee's address and ZIP code override field, likely to be incomplete

Fact.Name: Employee's address
Fact.Description: Box f of Form W-2, employee's address and ZIP code override field

Fact.Name: Employee's address zip in MeF Format
Fact.Description: The employee's address ZIP code, with hyphens and spaces stripped for MeF compliance

Fact.Name: Wages
Fact.Description: Box 1 of Form W-2, wages, tips, and other compensation. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Wages
Fact.Description: Box 1 of Form W-2, wages, tips, and other compensation.

Fact.Name: Federal income tax withheld
Fact.Description:
Box 2 of Form W-2, Federal income tax withheld.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Federal income tax withheld
Fact.Description: Box 2 of Form W-2, Federal income tax withheld.

Fact.Name: Social Security Wages
Fact.Description:
Box 3 of Form W-2, social security wages.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Social security wages
Fact.Description: Box 3 of Form W-2, social security wages. Includes non-taxable income, and excludes income that exceeds the wage cap.

We knockout filers who have multiple W-2s that sum to maxOasdiWagesOnMultipleW2sForOnePerson. To prevent filers who have multiple W-2s that don't all have social security wages, we only look at the first maxOasdiWagesOnMultipleW2sForOnePerson per W-2. So, this fact returns the either oasdiWages or maxOasdiWagesOnMultipleW2sForOnePerson, whichever is lower

Fact.Name: Social Security Tax Withheld
Fact.Description: Box 4 of Form W-2, social security tax withheld. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Social security tax withheld
Fact.Description: Box 4 of Form W-2, social security tax withheld.

Fact.Name: Medicare Wages
Fact.Description: Box 5 of Form W-2, Medicare wages and tips. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Medicare wages
Fact.Description: Box 5 of Form W-2, Medicare wages and tips. Includes non-taxable income.

Fact.Name: Total Medicare Wages
Fact.Description: The sum of all medicare wages across Form W-2s
Medicare Wages for the primary filer
Medicare wages for the secondary filer

Is any filer on the return over the limit that would qualify them for a credit for their medicare payments. Note this would only trigger if the filers are MFJ, since for non-MFJ filers, the limit would trigger anyway
Is any filer over the medicare tax threshhold such that they'd qualify for a refund of some of the medicare tax they paid.
The highest medicare wages a single person on the return recieved

Fact.Name: Medicare Tax Withheld
Fact.Description: Box 6 of Form W-2, Medicare tax withheld. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Medicare tax withheld
Fact.Description: Box 6 of Form W-2, Medicare tax withheld.

Fact.Name: Social Security Tips
Fact.Description: Box 7 of Form W-2, social security tips. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Social security tips
Fact.Description: Box 7 of Form W-2, social security tips.

Fact.Name: Allocated Tips
Fact.Description: Box 8 of Form W-2, allocated tips. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Allocated tips
Fact.Description: Box 8 of Form W-2, allocated tips. You may have an amount here if you receive tips at your job, but the amount of tips you reported falls below a certain percentage of food and drink sales (typically 8%). Allocated tips will need to be included as unreported tip income, unless you have adequate records to show that you received less than the allocated amount.

Fact.Name: W2 Scope Knockout
Fact.Description: Information on this W2 knocks the filer out of scope

Fact.Name: W2 Scope Knockout
Fact.Description: Information on this W2 knocks the filer out of scope
W2 Scope Knockout for Box 11 (nonqualified plans)

Fact.Name: Writable Dependent Care Benefits
Fact.Description:
Box 10 of Form W-2, dependent care benefits.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Dependent care benefits
Fact.Description: Box 10 of Form W-2, dependent care benefits. Amounts over $5,000 are included in box 1. Requires Form 2441, Child and Dependent Care Expenses to determine the taxable amount.

Fact.Name: All primary filer dependent care benefits
Fact.Description: The sum of Box 10 of all primary filers form W-2s, dependent care benefits. Used for form 2441, Child and Dependent Care Expenses to determine the taxable amount.

Fact.Name: All secondary filer dependent care benefits
Fact.Description: The sum of Box 10 of all secondary filers form W-2s, dependent care benefits. Used for form 2441, Child and Dependent Care Expenses to determine the taxable amount.

Fact.Name: Non-qualified Plans
Fact.Description:
Box 11 of Form W-2, non-qualified plans.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Non-qualified plans
Fact.Description: Box 11 of Form W-2, non-qualified plans. These are retirement plans not covered by the Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA). This compensation is excluded from box 1, but it is included in FICA wages.
Rounded 401k deferrals values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded 403b deferrals values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded SARSEP deferrals values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded 457b deferrals values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded 501(c)(18)(D) deferrals values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded SIMPLE contribution values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded Roth 401k contribution values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded Roth 403b contribution values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Rounded Roth 457b contribution values if they exist or 0, used so that we can easily sum
Summation of all deferrals and contributions, used as part of the calculation for Form 8880 Line 2

Fact.Name: 457(b) is governmental plan
Fact.Description: The 457(b) plan to which the filer contributed is a governmental 457(b).

Fact.Name: Knockout Box 12 Code
Fact.Description: Which of the box 12 codes that can knock a filer out have a positive value. Used to give the filer information which code knocked them out (and stays incomplete if the filer doesn't have a code that knocks them out)

Fact.Name: Box 12 Knockout
Fact.Description: Do any of the codes for box 12 that can knock a tax payer out have a positive value
A collection of W2s that have a Box 12 code we knockout
The "first" W2 that has a Box 12 code that knocks you out

Fact.Name: Has a Box 12 Value We Knockout
Fact.Description: Has the filer entered a W2 with any of the Box 12 codes we knockout

Fact.Name: Filer has input code W HSA contribution in Box 12 for this W2
Fact.Description: Whether filer has code W HSA contribution in Box 12 for this W2

Fact.Name: W2 belongs to filer which can be claimed as dependent and has HSA contributions in Box 12
Fact.Description: The W2 belongs to filer which can be claimed ad dependent and code W is entered in Box 12

Fact.Name: Knockout when Box 12 has contributions for code W but TP is dependent
Fact.Description: Filer has entered W2 contributions for HSA in Box 12 and has dependency status

Fact.Description: Whether this W2 has any codes or amounts in box 14

Fact.Name: MD resident has other Box 14 codes
Fact.Description: Whether a Maryland resident has indicated they have a Box 14 code on their W-2 that is not one of the existing options; used to determine whether to ask about union dues.

Fact.Name: Paid union dues
Amount of union dues paid
Amount of union dues paid
Fact.Description: The amount from Box 14 of codes related to dues paid for union membership; currently only asked of MD residents. This fact will be incomplete if the taxpayer changes prior answers, such as if they say they didn't pay union dues or they didn't live in MD.

Fact.Name: (Writable) Nontaxable combat pay
Fact.Description: The user transcribes this value as seen on box 12, code Q of a W-2. Represents combat pay. If left empty, the W-2 XML that we send to MeF will not have a corresponding EmployersUseCd element. Derived calculations will treat an empty field as 0. Note 1/18/2024: this use to be used directly before the zero export change.

Fact.Name: (Writable) Nontaxable combat pay needed
Fact.Description: Combat pay needed

Fact.Name: Nontaxable combat pay
Fact.Description: Box 12, code Q. Takes what the user said, but if they have not entered combat pay, assumes zero.

Fact.Name: Statutory employee
Fact.Description: Whether statutory employee is checked in box 13.

Fact.Name: Retirement plan
Fact.Description: Whether retirement plan is checked in box 13.

Fact.Name: Third-party sick pay
Fact.Description: Whether third-party sick pay is checked in box 13.

Fact.Name: State
Fact.Description: Part of form W-2 box 15: The state of residence.

Fact.Name: State
Fact.Description: Alias for writableState to avoid breaking the backend with our convention for optional fields.

Fact.Name: Flow Knockout Income from Unsupported State
Fact.Description: Used to control a knockout for if the filer recieved income from an unsupported state.

Fact.Name: Has Knockout recieved Income from a Different State
Fact.Description: Checks to see if their income is from a different state.

Fact.Name: State Code (pdf)
Fact.Description: The state code used to populate the IRS W2 PDF field corresponding to form W-2 box 15.

Fact.Name: State Code (xml)
Fact.Description: The state code used to populate the IRS W2 XML element corresponding to form W-2 box 15. This fact is used to handle mapping the values used by the DF client into what the MeF system and DF submit application expect.

Fact.Name: Employer's state ID number
Fact.Description: Part of form W-2 box 15: The employer's state ID number. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete, and will likely be left incomplete by states that do not collect personal income tax.

Fact.Name: Employer's state ID number
Fact.Description: Part of form W-2 box 15: The employer's state ID number. Alias for writableStateEmployerId.
Whether the form lists state wages but is missing the associated state code. Corresponds with a validation alert since the TP should always have a state code when they have state information

Fact.Name: State wages, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 16: Wages, tips, and other compensation allocated to the state. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: State wages, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 16: Wages, tips, and other compensation allocated to the state.

Fact.Name: Whether the W-2 is missing state income (box 16)
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 16: Wages, tips, and other compensation allocated to the state.

Fact.Name: State income tax
Fact.Description:
Form W-2 box 17: State income tax withheld.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: State income tax
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 17: State income tax withheld.

Fact.Name: Local wages, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 18: Wages, tips, and other compensation allocated to the locality. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Local wages, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 18: Wages, tips, and other compensation allocated to the locality.

Fact.Name: Local income tax
Fact.Description:
Form W-2 box 19: Local income tax withheld.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Local income tax
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 19: Local income tax withheld.

Fact.Name: Locality name
Fact.Description:
Form W-2 box 20: Locality name.
This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Locality name
Fact.Description: Form W-2 box 20: Locality name.

Fact.Name: Box 20 Yonkers boolean
Fact.Description: Does this W2 have Yonkers box 20 codes?

Fact.Name: Paid taxes in Yonkers
Fact.Description: Does the W2 show Yonkers taxes?

Fact.Name: Lived outside of Yonkers during TY
Fact.Description: Whether the taxpayer lived outside of Yonkers during the tax year, and is a part-year Yonkers resident.

Fact.Name: Knockout for part-year Yonkers residents
Fact.Description: The taxpayer paid taxes in Yonkers and said that they are a part-year resident of Yonkers

Fact.Name: MeF variable: nonstandard W2
Fact.Description: MeF Variable: the code for whether it is a standard or nonstandard Line 368 of the IRSW2 Schema

Fact.Name: Nonstandard or corrected choice
Fact.Description: Whether the form W2 is nonstandard, corrected, both, or neither

Fact.Name: W2 is corrected
Fact.Description: This is not a standard W2, it is marked as corrected

Fact.Name: W2 is nonstandard
Fact.Description: This is not a standard W2, it is marked as nonstandard

Fact.Name: W2 belongs to primary filer
Fact.Description: The W2 belongs to the primary filer

Fact.Name: W2 belongs to secondary filer
Fact.Description: The W2 belongs to the secondary filer

Fact.Name: Secondary filer has W2s when primary filer is not filing jointly
Fact.Description: Whether secondary filer has W2s when primary filer is not filing jointly

Fact.Name: Secondary filer has W2s when primary filer is not filing jointly
Fact.Description: Whether secondary filer has W2s when primary filer is not filing jointly

Fact.Name: Has Railroad Retirement Tax Act (RRTA) Codes
Fact.Description: Do any Railroad Retirement Tax Act (RRTA) codes show up in box 14 on this W2?

W-2 has a Box 17 (State income tax) value that is greater than the Box 16 (State wages, tips, etc) value.
Used to power a W-2 validation: State income tax cannot exceed state income amount.
Uses the writeable facts for these boxes and explicitly checks for completion, as the derived box values default to 0. Filling out a value for box 17 but not box 16 would then erroneously trigger this validation, for example, if using the derived facts for these boxes.
We only want to show this validation if the taxpayer entered a value for both boxes.

True if W2 has a value for Box 19 (Local income tax) and Box 18 (Local wages, tips, etc), and the value of Box 19 is greater than Box 18.
Derived box values default to 0, so this fact explicitly checks for completion; it's false if either box is incomplete.
Used to power a W-2 validation: Local income tax cannot exceed local income amount.

Fact.Name: Form W-2 withholding
Fact.Description: Federal income tax withheld from wages, as reported on line 25a of Form 1040.

Fact.Name: Wages, salaries, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Wage income to report on line 1a of Form 1040.

Fact.Name: Primary Filer wages, salaries, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Wage income to use in calculating earned income for CDCC

Fact.Name: Primary filer has W2 Wages greater than 0
Fact.Description: Whether primary filer has wages greater than 0
Primary filers total HSA contributions reported on their W-2s
Whether the primary filer has HSA contributions reported on their W-2s

Fact.Name: Secondary filer wages, salaries, tips, etc.
Fact.Description: Wage income to use in calculating earned income for CDCC

Fact.Name: Secondary filer has W2 wages greater than 0
Fact.Description: Whether secondary filer has wages greater than 0
Primary filers total HSA contributions reported on their W-2s
Whether the secondary filer has HSA contributions reported on their W-2s
The total amount of HSA contributions reported on the TPs W2s
Whether we already know the TP has HSA contributions reported on their W2

Fact.Name: Social Security taxes withheld
Fact.Description: The amount of social security and medicare tax withheld, as defined by §24(d)(2).

Fact.Name: Primary Filer W2s
Fact.Description: The W2s that belong to the primary filer

Fact.Name: Primary Filter W2s Count
Fact.Description: How many W2s does the primary filer have?

Fact.Name: Primary Filer Total Social Security Wages
Fact.Description: Sum of Social Security Wages across Primary Filer W2s

Fact.Name: Secondary Filer W2s
Fact.Description: The W2s that belong to the secondary filer

Fact.Name: Secondary Filter W2s Count
Fact.Description: How many W2s does the secondary filer have?

Fact.Name: Secondary Filer Total Social Security Wages
Fact.Description: Sum of Social Security Wages across Secondary Filer W2s

Fact.Name: Some filer has combat pay
Fact.Description: Either the primary filer or their MFJ spouse has combat pay on at least one of their W2s.

Fact.Name: Only one filer has combat pay
Fact.Description: Either the primary filer or their MFJ spouse (if MFJ) has combat pay on one of their W2s.

Fact.Name: MFJ Spouse has combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether a TP has an MFJ spouse and that MFJ spouse has combat pay on at least one of their W2s

Fact.Name: MFJ Spouse Combat Pay
Fact.Description: The amount of combat pay an MFJ spouse has on all of their W2s combined. Returns zero if filing status is not MFJ

Fact.Name: Only MFJ Spouse has combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether or not ONLY the MFJ Spouse has combat pay on at least one of their W2s and the primary does not

Fact.Name: TP has combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether a TP has combat pay on at least one of their W2s

Fact.Name: TP combat pay
Fact.Description: The amount of combat pay for the primary filer reported on their W2s.

Fact.Name: Only primary filer has combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether or not ONLY the primary TP has combat pay on at least one of their W2s and the secondary filer does not have combat pay

Fact.Name: Do both filers have combat pay?
Fact.Description: Whether the primary filer and their MFJ spouse has combat pay on at least one of their W2s.

Fact.Name: Both filers combat pay
Fact.Description: The combined amount of combat pay from both primary filter and MFJ spouse.

Fact.Name: Combat Pay if Elected
Fact.Description: The combat pay for line 1i, taking into account whether the user wants to declare it or not.

Fact.Name: Nontaxable combat pay
Fact.Description:
Nontaxable combat pay. Note: don't go including this on line 1i of the 1040; that box should only be filled in if the taxpayer elects to include combat pay as earned income for purposes of calculating the Earned Income Tax Credit or Child and Dependent Care Credit.
This value is reported on line 18b of schedule 8812, used to calculate ACTC.
Additionally, be careful to appropriately separate spouse and taxpayer combat pay if MFJ. The TP can elect to include neither, either, or both of their combat pay on line 1i.
